content.full_text:
Abraham Lincoln to John M. Clayton, 4 July 18491 I understand the name of our excellent friend Hon.R. W Thompson, ofIndiana, is before you for some diplomatic appointment–  It needs no one to tell you who
               he is, and I wish to say, as matter of substance, and not of form merely, that I sincerely
               desire he may be successful–2
